# run()

**Instance Method**

Runs the print operation on the current thread.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func run() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the operation was successful; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

The operation runs to completion in the current thread, blocking the application. A separate thread is not spawned, even if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation/canSpawnSeparateThread] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. Use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation/runModal(for:delegate:didRun:contextInfo:)] to use document-modal sheets and to allow a separate thread to perform the operation.

## Running the Print Operation

- **runModal(for:delegate:didRun:contextInfo:)**: Runs the print operation, calling your custom delegate method upon completion.
- **cleanUp()**: Called at the end of a print operation to remove the print operation as the current operation.
- **deliverResult()**: Delivers the results of the print operation to the intended destination.
